text: Alexander II (; 29 April 181813 March 1881) was Emperor of Russia, King of Poland and Grand Duke of Finland from 1855 until his assassination in 1881. Alexander's most significant liberal reform as emperor was the emancipation of Russia's serfs in 1861, for which he is known as Alexander the Liberator. ==Notes== ==References== Category:Emperors and Empresses of Russia Category:Deaths by suicide bomber Category:1818 births Category:1881 deaths Category:House of Holstein-Gottorp-Romanov
title: Alexander II of Russia
